title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: can install development version outlierTests like :
code: remotes::install_github("heike/outlierTests") #> Using GitHub PAT from the git credential store. #> Skipping install of 'outlierTests' from a github remote, the SHA1 (c0867832) has not changed since last install. #>   Use `force = TRUE` to force installation

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem: NIST Engineering Statistics Handbook: following set 8 numbers mass spectrometer measurements uranium isotope (Tietjen Moore)[doi/abs/10.1080/00401706.1972.10488948]:

what: Grubbs Test for one outlier in a normal sample — grubbsTest
title: Grubbs Test for one outlier in a normal sample — grubbsTest
text: original paper states reject absolute maximum deviate G significance level alpha/n one-sided tests alpha/(2n) two sided tests.

title: Grubbs Test for one outlier in a normal sample — grubbsTest
Grubbs Test for one outlier in a normal sample — grubbsTest
text: x vector normally distributed data values alternative character value  specifying alternative hypothesis. must one "max" (default), "min" "two.sided". alpha significance level rejection, acceptable Type 1 error.

title: Grubbs Test for one outlier in a normal sample — grubbsTest
text: Grubbs, F. (1950). Sample Criteria Testing Outlying Observations. Annals Mathematical Statistics, 21(1), 27–58. https://doi.org/10.1214/aoms/1177729885

title: Grubbs Test for one outlier in a normal sample — grubbsTest
code: # example code x <- c(199.31, 199.53, 200.19, 200.82, 201.92, 201.95, 202.18, 245.57) grubbsTest(x) #> $statistic #> [1] 2.468765 #>  #> $parameter #> $parameter$df #> [1] 8 #>  #> $parameter$sigma #> [1] 15.85256 #>  #>  #> $p.value #> [1] 1.547663e-07 #>  #> $estimate #> $estimate$max #> [1] 245.57 #>  #>  #> $method #> [1] "Grubbs test" #>  #> $critical #> [1] 2.031652 #>  #> $alpha #> [1] 0.05 #>  #> $alternative #> [1] "max" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "grubbsTest"

title: The Grubbs G Distribution — qGrubbs
text: Quantile function distribution function extreme absolute deviate G normal sample defined \( G = \max (G_1, G_n),\) \(G_i = \frac{|x_{()} - \bar{x}|}{s}\) ordered sample \(x_{}\) \(x_{(1)} \le x_{(2)} \le ... \le x_{(n)}\). \(\bar{x}\) \(s^2\) sample mean variance defined $$\bar{x} = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{=1}^n x_i text{ } s^2 = \frac{1}{n-1}\sum_{=1}^n (x_i - \bar{x})^2.$$

title: The Grubbs G Distribution — qGrubbs
code: qGrubbs(p, n, two.sided, lower.tail = FALSE)  pGrubbs(x, n, two.sided, lower.tail = FALSE)

title: The Grubbs G Distribution — qGrubbs
text: p vector probabilities. n sample size. two.sided logical; TRUE, outlier can either minimum maximum. lower.tail logical; FALSE (default), probabilities \(P(G > g)\), otherwise \(P(G \le g)\). x vector quantiles.
